item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, December 11, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. FCC opens entire 6 GHz band to low power device operations (295 points | 113 comments)
2. QEMU with VirtIO GPU Vulkan Support (42 points | discuss)
3. AI Guesses Your Accent (72 points | 73 comments)
4. PeerTube mobile app: discover videos while caring for your attention (272 points | 103 comments)
5. Review of Mullvad VPN (145 points | 33 comments)
6. Launch HN: Azalea Robotics (YC S24) – Baggage-handling robots for airports (68 points | 42 comments)
7. Mysterious New Jersey drone sightings prompt call for 'state of emergency' (22 points | 30 comments)
8. Instant macOS install on Proxmox including AMD patches (29 points | 3 comments)
9. RISC-V HiFive Premier P550 Development Boards with Ubuntu Now Available (106 points | 49 comments)
10. Storing Times for Human Events (43 points | 14 comments)
11. Borax or Baking Soda Rectifier and the glow (2003) (33 points | 3 comments)
12. Pgroll – Zero-downtime, reversible, schema changes for PostgreSQL (new website) (121 points | 29 comments)
13. Dioxus 0.6 – Crossplatform apps with Rust (164 points | 67 comments)
14. A letter to open-source maintainers (14 points | discuss)
15. Gemini 2.0: our new AI model for the agentic era (540 points | 279 comments)
16. Charge Robotics (YC S21) is hiring MechEs to build robots that build solar farms ( | hide)
17. 2400 phone providers may be shut down by the FCC for failing to stop robocalls (98 points | 63 comments)
18. Django and Postgres for the Busy Rails Developer (100 points | 47 comments)
19. Trillium TPU Is GA (87 points | 50 comments)
20. Bankruptcy judge rejects sale of Infowars to The Onion (483 points | 732 comments)
21. Show HN: Convert your LinkedIn profile to a resume (26 points | 32 comments)
22. The Program, my fiction podcast launched on HN, 5 years and 1M downloads later (14 points | 5 comments)
23. Making memcpy(NULL, NULL, 0) well-defined (185 points | 175 comments)
24. Chatbot hinted a kid should kill his parents over screen time limits: lawsuit (8 points | 69 comments)
25. Three Packets Walk into a Tunnel (4 points | discuss)
26. Consider Rexx for Scripting (2022) (27 points | 22 comments)
27. Dear OAuth Providers (89 points | 20 comments)
28. Helium: Lighter Web Automation with Python (130 points | 43 comments)
29. OpenLoco: An open source re-implementation of Chris Sawyer's Locomotion (52 points | 16 comments)
30. WPEngine, Inc. vs. Automattic– Order on Motion for Preliminary Injunction (316 points | 134 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, December 11, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
